item.title: Aggregate Data with Nested Groups
item.description: A Short General Primer on Loops In my daily programming I barely use any base for loops. I used to rely on lapply and friends a lot, then switched to the plyr family of apply functions and eventually ended up using the purr::map_* family of functions. There is a bit of overhead involved in mapand [lvs]apply can be faster / more efficient, but I do like the verbosity of map and friends as well as the possibility to use lambda functions via ~1.
